column4: This is really urgent: is there a log of GNOME remote desktop connections made?
because someone's been remoted into my PC for a few hours
I'm at Uni, no control. I normally don't have VNC turned on.
The weird thing is... they brute forced a very hard password... or GNOME's implementation has a security flaw.
I mean, my password was 20 characters long....
Are you telling me Vino has known exploits ilessthan3ubuntu ?
i thought you guys said vnc

I think this should now be tagged as a security vulnerability since multiple people with complex passwords protecting their Vino servers have been compromised. It makes me think that Vino is vulnerable to the same vulnerability, or something similar, as below.
then im saying your pwd makes no difference depending on the vuln.
... I understand that... but are we just jumping to assuming that Vino has vulnerabilities? Known ones?
why is it called vino and not vnc again?
Vino is the GNOME impl of VNC server
